topic.title: FlexO Datapath

body.p: In the FlexO datapath, the FlexO block interfaces to DSIS on its line side and to the OTU frame on its system side.

The FlexO block acts at the source and sink termination of up to six FlexO groups. Each FlexO group contains from 1 to 6 FlexO members, each of which carries an OTUC stream. An OTUCn is carried in a FlexO group consisting of n FlexO members. The maximum number of FlexO members supported in the FlexO block is six. Each FlexO member is associated with an FOIC interface. On the line-side, the FlexO block supports up to six FOIC1.4 or FOIC1.2 interfaces. Each FOIC interface is independently configurable to be an FOIC1.4 or an FOIC1.2.

In the receive direction, the FlexO block performs OTSiG/FlexO adaptation sink functions, FlexO trail termination functions, and FlexO-n/OTUCn adaptation sink functions. The resultant OTUC streams are sent to OTU Framer. The OTU Framer performs OTU trail termination sink functions and OTU/ODU adaptation sink functions, sending the resulting ODU frames to COREOTN.

In the transmit direction, on ODU frames received from COREOTN, OTU framer block performs OTU/ODU adaptation source functions, and OTU trail termination source functions. The resulting OTU frames are sent to the FlexO block. The FlexO block performs FlexO-n/OTUCn adaptation sink functions, FlexO trail termination functions, and OTSiG/FlexO adaptation source functions, sending the resulting FlexO stream towards the DSIS.
